content: in next st 7 times join to top of chain 3 fasten_off and secure ends stitch count 16 double_crochet 3 a2/h2 hint you will have 1 double_crochet on each side of the bead stitch join with a standing double_crochet in any st in the same st bead st double_crochet skip next st double_crochet bead st double_crochet in next st 7 times join to standing double_crochet with a sl-st do not fasten_off stitch count 16 double_crochet 8 bead sts 4 hint remember each bead st has 2 sets of top loops/counts as 2 sts sl-st into next 2 sts chain 3 counts as double_crochet 6 double_crochet in the same st skip next 3 sts 7 double_crochet in next st 7 times skip next 3 sts join to top of chain 3 fasten_off and secure ends stitch count 8 fans with 7 double_crochet each 3 original design by ineke mooijenkind copyright © 2019 all rights reserved 5 a3/h3 hint dcs going into r4 are creating a dip do not make them too loose join with a standing bphdc around last double_crochet of any fan work over r4 and double_crochet between the 2 dcs of r3 bphdc around next 7 sts 8 times omit last bphdc join to standing bphdc with a sl-st do not fasten_off stitch count 8 double_crochet 8 fans with 7 bphdc each your work will be wobbly 6 chain 3 counts as double_crochet double_crochet in next 2 sts put a marker around the post of the 2nd double_crochet made in the double_crochet of r5 half_double_crochet in next 2 sts single_crochet in next st half_double_crochet in next 2 sts double_crochet in next 3 sts 8 times omit last 3 double_crochet join to top of chain 3 fasten_off and secure ends stitch count 8 single_crochet 32 half_double_crochet 24 double_crochet 7 a1/h4 join with a standing fltr in any st fltr in next 63 sts join through the back loop of the standing fltr and the back loop of the corresponding st of r6 with a sl-st if possible pick up the 3rd loop to maintain stability p1 the stitches will fold but this is ok do not fasten_off stitch count 64 fltr 4 original design by ineke mooijenkind copyright © 2019 all rights reserved 8 for folding single_crochet see special stitches remember to pick up where possible the 3rd loop to maintain stability chain 1 and fsc in the same stitch mark this first st to be sure you don t accidentally join to the ch1 fsc in next 63 sts join to first fsc fasten_off and secure ends stitch count 64 fsc 9 a2/h5 join with a standing double_crochet in fsc made in marked st p1 *half_double_crochet in next 2 sts single_crochet in next 3 sts half_double_crochet in next 2 sts double_crochet in next 3 sts treble_crochet in next st in next st 2 treble_crochet dtr 2 treble_crochet treble_crochet in next st double_crochet in next 3 sts * repeat *to* 3 more times omit last double_crochet join to standing double_crochet
